sense.name: crowd or pack to capacity; stuff
sense.examples: He crammed the letters into his pockets. Spectators crammed the lofts to watch the fight. Scientists crammed the shuttle full of cultural momentos and photos. I tried to cram one last pair of shoes into my suitcase.

sense.name: study intensively as if preparing for a test
sense.examples: We got no break, just time to cram for finals. I was up all night because I had to cram for a history test. I've got to cram for my job interview, it's been a while since I've spoken Italian.
